sources.title: Eagle in a Cage
sources.description: In 1815, following his final defeat at Waterloo, French emperor Napoleon Bonaparte (Kenneth Haigh) arrives at St. Helena, the barren, wind-swept South Atlantic island to which the British and their allies have exiled him. Guarding Napoleon are troops led by English general Sir Hudson Lowe (Ralph Richardson), the island's governor. Although Lowe allows Napoleon and his small entourage his valet, Haitian bodyguard General Gourgaud (Moses Gunn), and chief aide Count Bertrand (Ferdy Mayne) and Bertrand's wife (Billie Whitelaw) to move freely around the island, Napoleon bristles at the idea of being Lowe's prisoner.

sources.title: Eagle in a Cage (1972)

sources.title: Eagle in a Cage (1972) JOHN GIELGUD
sources.description:
Stars: John Gielgud, Ralph Richardson, Billie Whitelaw
Director: Fielder Cook

On the prison island of St. Helena, a soldier is given the responsibility of governorship and jailer to Napoleon, the once mighty Emperor of France!

metadata.Plot: In 1815, a soldier becomes the Governor of St. Helena, and jailer of Napoleon.
metadata.Actors: Billie Whitelaw, Ralph Richardson, John Gielgud
